article_title: Beijing’s Stock-Plunge Response Dims Index Hopes
article_text:
NEW YORK—Hopes that Chinese shares would soon be included in major global indexes turbocharged their sharp run-up this year. Since one major index provider decided last month to keep them out, the Shanghai market has lost nearly a quarter of its value.

Beijing’s frantic response to the bust dims those index hopes, investors say.

When index provider MSCI Inc. held off adding Chinese A-shares—stocks denominated in yuan and...

twitter.description: Chinese authorities’ frantic measures to fight the market bust could hurt the chances that the country’s stocks will soon be included in major global indexes.
twitter.title: Beijing’s Stock-Plunge Response Dims Index Hopes
